Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, slightly ribbed, remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.178)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36412) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36412)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 269 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13458 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
